org.microbean.jersey.netty

Class ByteBufChunkedInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.jersey.netty.FunctionalByteBufChunkedInput<ByteBuf>
      • org.microbean.jersey.netty.ByteBufChunkedInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChunkedInput<ByteBuf>

    public class ByteBufChunkedInput
extends FunctionalByteBufChunkedInput<ByteBuf>
    A FunctionalByteBufChunkedInput that reads from a ByteBuf.

    Thread Safety

    Instances of this class are safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the operations performed on the ByteBuf instance retained by this class are not guaranteed to be threadsafe. This class assumes that it will be invoked on Netty's event loop thread. Invoking it on any thread other than Netty's event loop thread may result in undefined behavior.

    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    FunctionalByteBufChunkedInput

    • Constructor Detail

      • ByteBufChunkedInput

        public ByteBufChunkedInput(ByteBuf sourceByteBuf)
        Creates a new ByteBufChunkedInput whose FunctionalByteBufChunkedInput.length() method will return -1L.
        Parameters:
        sourceByteBuf - the ByteBuf from which chunks will be read; must not be null
        See Also:
        ByteBufChunkedInput(ByteBuf, long)

      • ByteBufChunkedInput

        public ByteBufChunkedInput(ByteBuf sourceByteBuf,
                           long lengthToReport)
        Creates a new ByteBufChunkedInput.
        Parameters:
        sourceByteBuf - the ByteBuf from which chunks will be read; must not be null
        lengthToReport - the length of this ByteBufChunkedInput in bytes to be reported by the FunctionalByteBufChunkedInput.length() method; may be -1L (and very often is) if a representation of its length is not available.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sourceByteBuf is null
